advjava.assessment1.zuul.refactored.character

Class NonPlayerCharacter

  • java.lang.Object
    • advjava.assessment1.zuul.refactored.character.Character
      • advjava.assessment1.zuul.refactored.character.NonPlayerCharacter

  • public class NonPlayerCharacter
extends Character
    AI controlled Character class, implements all functionality provided by it's superclass Character.
    Author:
    Daniel

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      NonPlayerCharacter(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String description, Room room)
      Third constructor, assumes no items are provided or a maximum weight is provided and such provides an empty list as well as the DEFAULT_MAX_WEIGHT.
      NonPlayerCharacter(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String description, Room room, java.util.List<Item> items)
      Second constructor, assumes MAX_WEIGHT over defined weight as parameter.
      NonPlayerCharacter(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String description, Room room, java.util.List<Item> items, int maxWeight)
      Default constructor for creating a NPC, provides all creation ability.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void act(Game game)
      Let the NPC act out a behaviour, by default this method will generate a random value to determine whether this NPC should move rooms.
      boolean isPlayer()
      Returns false, as this is a NPC.

    • Constructor Detail

      • NonPlayerCharacter

        public NonPlayerCharacter(java.lang.String name,
                          java.lang.String description,
                          Room room,
                          java.util.List<Item> items,
                          int maxWeight)
                   throws InvalidCharacterNamingException
        Default constructor for creating a NPC, provides all creation ability. Passing a maxWeight <= 0 will establish the DEFAULT_MAX_WEIGHT for the NPC instead.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of NPC
        description - Description of NPC
        room - NPC room
        items - NPC items in inventory
        maxWeight - NPC maxWeight
        Throws:
        InvalidCharacterNamingException - If the NPC's name is null or an empty String

      • NonPlayerCharacter

        public NonPlayerCharacter(java.lang.String name,
                          java.lang.String description,
                          Room room,
                          java.util.List<Item> items)
                   throws InvalidCharacterNamingException
        Second constructor, assumes MAX_WEIGHT over defined weight as parameter.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of NPC
        description - Description of NPC
        room - NPC room
        items - NPC items in inventory
        Throws:
        InvalidCharacterNamingException - If the NPC's name is null or an empty String

      • NonPlayerCharacter

        public NonPlayerCharacter(java.lang.String name,
                          java.lang.String description,
                          Room room)
                   throws InvalidCharacterNamingException
        Third constructor, assumes no items are provided or a maximum weight is provided and such provides an empty list as well as the DEFAULT_MAX_WEIGHT.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of NPC
        description - Description of NPC
        room - NPC room
        Throws:
        InvalidCharacterNamingException - If the NPC's name is null or an empty String

    • Method Detail

      • isPlayer

        public final boolean isPlayer()
        Returns false, as this is a NPC.
        Specified by:
        isPlayer in class Character
        Returns:
        false

      • act

        public void act(Game game)
        Let the NPC act out a behaviour, by default this method will generate a random value to determine whether this NPC should move rooms. To implement different behaviour create a subclass of NonPlayerCharacter and Override this functionality.
        Parameters:
        game - The game instance
